name: num::nonzero::NonZero::<u64>::checked_next_power_of_two

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

num::<impl u64>::checked_next_power_of_t.doc:
Returns the smallest power of two greater than or equal to `self`. If
 the next power of two is greater than the type's maximum value,
 `None` is returned, otherwise the power of two is wrapped in `Some`.

 # Examples

 ```
 ```

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecke.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.

option::Option: Unknown([Downcast(VariantIdx(1, ThreadLocalIndex)), Field(0, Ty { id: 325, kind: RigidTy(Uint(U64)) })])
